issues.description: The UML in the problem statement declares getTotalNumberOfStudents() to return a String (UML: getTotalNumberOfStudents(): String), but the reference solution implements getTotalNumberOfStudents() returning an int. The problem text also suggests the method should return a numeric total, so the UML return type is inconsistent with the intended implementation. This mismatch can confuse students (they are explicitly told to check the UML for the expected return type) and could lead them to implement the method with the wrong return type.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the UML and problem text with the intended implementation. Change the UML entry in problem_statement.md from getTotalNumberOfStudents(): String to getTotalNumberOfStudents(): int (and update any explanatory text that refers to the UML). Alternatively, if the exercise truly intends a String return, update the solution and template signatures/tests accordingly. The simplest fix preserving the current solution is to update the UML to use int.
